meanings.definition: The act of bursting or exploding.
meanings.sent1: The plosion of the balloon filled the room with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks ended with a loud plosion.
meanings.sent3: The plosion of the surprise party startled everyone.
meanings.sent4: The plosion of laughter erupted from the audience.
meanings.sent5: The plosion of colors in the sky was breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: The unexpected plosion made me jump.
meanings.sent2: The thunderstorm brought plosion after plosion.
meanings.sent3: The plosion of the door slamming shut echoed through the house.
meanings.sent4: The plosion of applause filled the theater.
meanings.sent5: The plosion of the drum signaled the start of the performance.
